required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hub Cleansing to Prevent Hub Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Hub Cleansing to Prevent Hub Infection

collaborator.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: Central venous catheter infections are common preventable adverse events among hospital patients. Microbes may enter catheter hubs, also known as needleless connectors, and result in downstream contamination. This study aims to compare alcohol disinfection of catheter hubs to disinfection with chlorhexidine gluconate in alcohol, which has been proven to be a superior disinfectant at the site of central venous catheter insertion. Scrub duration of central venous catheter hubs will also be evaluated.

detailed_description.textblock:
A prospective randomized blinded crossover clinical trial will be performed in the medical intensive care unit at Rush University Medical Center. The intensive care unit will be divided into two regions (A&B). Hub disinfectants and duration of disinfection will be randomly assigned to these regions. After 1/2 of the study period, the agents will crossover, but the duration of scrubbing will remain the same, analogous to a 2 by 2 factorial design. Our primary endpoint will be internal contamination of hubs and catheters.
In February 2012 it was determined that the supplier of chlorhexidine and alcohol pads could not completely blind each pad. It was decided that a plain white sticker would be affixed to the front of each pad, but the safety information on the back of each pad would remain visible.
3/27/12-Internal hub contamination (yes/no)was clarified as the primary outcome.
On 5/10/12 a new sample size calculation adjusted the hub sample size needed to power the main effects based on more accurate information regarding the expected hub contamination rate. The expected hub contamination rate changed because of the more sensitive hub culture method that was adopted before the study began. This more sensitive method also allowed for a new secondary outcome of number of microbial colony forming units per hub.
The first crossover time selected was 6/11/12, prior to the midpoint of the study. This was done to try to improve a large imbalance in the group sizes.
On 6/11/12 a hold was placed on the catheter tip component of the study, because of an inability to collect tips.
On 8/7/12 the catheter tip outcome was dropped because of an inability to collect tips.
On 1/11/13 a second crossover was implemented in an effort to balance the sizes of the study groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Central Venous Catheter Hubs With Internal Contamination
primary_outcome.description: This will be a qualitative outcome. It will be reported as "yes" or "no" for central venous catheter hub internal contamination. The number of hubs with internal contamination will be compared for the four study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Contaminated Central Venous Catheter Tips
secondary_outcome.description: This will be a qualitative measure for central venous catheter tip contamination. The results will be reported as "yes" or "no".

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Number of Microbial Colony Forming Units Per Hub Interior
secondary_outcome.description: This will be a quantitative outcome. It will be reported as the median number of microbial colony forming units isolated per hub interior. The median number of microbial colony forming units isolated per hub interior will be compared for the four study arms.

arm_group.description: 70% isopropyl alcohol will be used to scrub catheter hubs for a duration of 5 seconds.
70% isopropyl alcohol will be used to scrub catheter hubs for a duration of 15 seconds.
3.15% chlorhexidine/70% isopropyl alcohol will be used to scrub catheter hubs for a duration of 5 seconds.
3.15% chlorhexidine/70% isopropyl alcohol will be used to scrub catheter hubs for a duration of 15 seconds.

intervention.description: Scrub catheter hubs for 15 seconds before every access.
Scrub catheter hubs for 15 seconds before every access.
3.15% chlorhexidine gluconate in 70% isopropyl alcohol pads will be used to disinfect catheter hubs prior to accessing central venous catheters during half of the study period.
intervention.other_name: Professional Disposables International Inc. Chlorascrub Swab

intervention.description: 70% isopropyl alcohol pads will be used to disinfect catheter hubs prior to accessing central venous catheters for the other half of the study period.
intervention.other_name: Professional Disposable International Inc Alcohol Prep Pad

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical intensive care unit patients with non-tunneled central venous catheters
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dialysis catheters
- Antibiotic-impregnated catheters
- Introducer sheaths
- Tunneled catheters

overall_official.affiliation: Cook County Health and Hospital Systems

patient_data.ipd_description: Rush University Medical Center adheres to the NIH Grant Policy on Sharing of Unique Research Resources including the Sharing of Biomedical Research Resources Principles and Guidelines for Recipients of NIH Grants and Contracts. Our response to requests for research resources from academic and other non-profit investigators will be timely and will be based on the Simple Letter Agreement for the Transfer of Materials as described in the Guidelines for Disseminating Research Resources Arising Out of NIH-Funded Research (Federal Register, Vol. 64, No 246, p.72094), and will not be more restrictive than the Uniform Biological Materials Transfer Agreement (UBMTA). Any intellectual property resulting from this study that can be patented will remain easily and widely available to the researchers in accordance with the NIH Principles and Guidelines. Distribution of resources to for-profit entities may occur under material transfer agreements or non-exclusive license arrangements.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 140 participants were recruited through 149 separate medical intensive care unit (MICU) admissions. Each MICU admission is treated as a separate enrollment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Two separate wings of a 24-bed MICU were randomized to receive different intervention sequences. Wing A was assigned to a 15 sec scrub of 1) Alcohol; 2) chlorhexidine gluconate (CHG)+Alcohol; 3) Alcohol; and Wing B was assigned to a 5 sec scrub of 1) CHG+Alcohol; 2) Alcohol; 3) CHG+Alcohol.

group.title: Alcohol, 15 Second Scrub
group.description: - Description: Each catheter hub was disinfected before each access by scrubbing with 70% isopropyl alcohol alone for 15 sec

group.title: Chlorhexidine+Alcohol, 15 Second Scrub
group.description: - Description: Each catheter hub was disinfected before each access by scrubbing with 3.15% chlorhexidine gluconate(CHG)/70% isopropyl alcohol for 15 sec

group.title: Alcohol, 5 Second Scrub
group.description: - Description: Each catheter hub was disinfected before each access by scrubbing with 70% isopropyl alcohol alone for 5 sec.

group.title: Chlorhexidine+Alcohol, 5 Second Scrub
group.description: - Description: Each catheter hub was disinfected before each access by scrubbing with 3.15% chlorhexidine gluconate(CHG)/70% isopropyl alcohol for 5 sec

baseline.population: 140 participants, 149 separate MICU admissions, 509 hubs total. Each MICU admission is treated as a separate enrollment.

outcome.title: Number of Contaminated Central Venous Catheter Tips
outcome.description: This will be a qualitative measure for central venous catheter tip contamination. The results will be reported as "yes" or "no".
outcome.population: Unable to collect a sufficient number of catheter tips to analyze. Therefore, this outcome was dropped early in the study.

outcome.title: Median Number of Microbial Colony Forming Units Per Hub Interior
outcome.description: This will be a quantitative outcome. It will be reported as the median number of microbial colony forming units isolated per hub interior. The median number of microbial colony forming units isolated per hub interior will be compared for the four study arms.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Single MICU Large number of eligible hubs not evaluated Unbalanced hub collection among study arms Studied hub contamination only; unable to collect catheter tips Did not study central-line associated bloodstream infection itself
